text: Lower Silesian Voivodeship is one of the 16 Voivodeships of Poland. It can be found in the south-west Poland and in west Silesia (called Lower Silesia). The capital city is Wrocław. The voivodeship was created on 1 January 1999 out of the former Wrocław, Legnica, Wałbrzych and Jelenia Góra Voivodeships. Karkonosze National Park and Stołowe Mountains National Park are both in Lower Silesian Voivodeship. Category:1999 establishments in Poland
title: Lower Silesian Voivodeship
